item.title: System uptime.md
item.description: High Availability is the property of a system which measures its uptime. When you measure your system’s uptime and are confident that no matter what, at minimum your system remains up x hours per year you can offer it as a commitment to the users of your system by signing a SLA (Service-level agreement) System uptime is usually expressed as three nines, four nines or five nines. You can traslate it into uptime or downtime hours per year by multiplying it with the total number of hours in a year (8760).
